Our team is inspired to change the world by making energy greener, and more affordable. Established in 2011 in London, UK, and now headquartered in Gurgaon, India. From unassuming beginnings, we have become a leading energy-AI software player, at the vanguard of accelerating the global energy transition.

In 2020, we were acquired by ReNew Power, India’s largest renewables developer. Following ReNew’s NASDAQ listing in summer 2021, Climate Connect Digital has been newly formed as a fully independent subsidiary. With backing from ReNew for an ambitious and visionary new strategy, for rapid growth.

Our mission has technology at its core and involves unlocking value by leveraging information technology and AI/ML across the energy ecosystem. However, the world is still nascent in using such technologies in the energy sector to create massive value for all stakeholders

Job Description

What you’ll work on:
As a Senior Software Engineer in Test, you will participate in a fast-paced Agile development team, building financial web applications and services. Your main responsibilities will be to design, develop, and implement manual and automated tests for software solutions that scale across hundreds of servers as well as learn and leverage the current methodologies and technologies, including Scrum and BDD. This specific opportunity is with the Fixed Income team.

What you'll work on:
Creates and manages automated test cases using Zephyr driving Selenium Webdriver, and BDD
Develops and executes manual tests and test strategies
Works with developers and product owners closely to review test coverage
Able to quickly learn new technology and business areas and to apply these to new projects and products within the Fixed Income business/technology arena


Strong written and verbal interpersonal skills
Able to deal effectively with internal and external staff, vendors, clients
Proficiency in Java and C# coding practices
Ability to write SQL queries
Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams
Ability to advocate quality initiatives and best practices including test automation, Continuous Integration, and Sprint Doneness within an Agile Development environment
Insight and working knowledge/experience of test design in both a manual and automated framework, such as Zephyr, Selenium Webdriver and BDD
Strong understanding of technologies and frameworks such as IntelliJ, Visual Studio, XML, SOAP, and JSON


BA or BS in Computer Science or related field strongly preferred but not required
5 or more years of software development and/or testing experience
Experience with testing SaaS, Financial, web, or cloud applications
Experience with Atlassian or similar toolsets on an Agile project is a plus.

description:
Working at Atlassian

Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or from an office (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company.

Atlassian is looking for a Software Engineer to design, build, evolve and maintain our web frontend systems and tools that enable our product teams to deliver great experiences to our users.
Your daily work will help our fellow Atlassian engineers to work more productively, deliver effortlessly, and the decisions you make will impact Atlassian’s overall product quality.

Our office is in Bengaluru, but we offer flexibility for eligible candidates to work remotely across India. Whatever your preference—working from home, an office, or in between— you can choose the place that’s best for your work and your lifestyleShow MoreReport

At Nielsen, we believe that career growth is a partnership. You ultimately own, fuel and set the journey. By joining our team of nearly 14,000 associates, you will become part of a community that will help you to succeed. We champion you because when you succeed, we do too. Embark on a new initiative, explore a fresh approach, and take license to think big, so we can all continuously improve. We enable your best to power our future.

Nielsen‘s mission is to help marketers and media companies measure and improve advertising performance by accurately reporting on what consumers watch, see, or hear (whether on television, the web, in print, or on the radio).

As a Developer, you will be responsible for building the next generation tools to help Nielsen’s audience measurement. The candidate will collaborate with various stakeholders to ensure that the software is built per specifications and with the highest quality.

The candidate must be a self starter with a desire to understand our unique business and the associated technical challenges. This requires a self-managed strong technical candidate that can take special projects from inception to completion.Show MoreReport
